org.apache.ace.it

Class IntegrationTestBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.ace.it.IntegrationTestBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleTest

    public class IntegrationTestBase
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    Base class for integration tests. There is no technical reason to use this, but it might make your life easier.

    ExampleTest shows a minimal example of an integration test.

      • runBare

        public final void runBare()
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overridden to ensure that our tearDown() method is always called, even when setUp() fails with an exception (by default, JUnit does not call this method when the set up fails).
        Overrides:
        runBare in class junit.framework.TestCase
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        TestCase.runBare()

      • configure

        protected void configure(java.lang.String pid,
                         java.lang.String... configuration)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Write configuration for a single service. For example, 
         configure("org.apache.felix.http",
     "org.osgi.service.http.port", "1234");
        Parameters:
        pid - the configuration PID to configure;
        configuration - the configuration key/values (as pairs).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • configureAdditionalServices

        protected void configureAdditionalServices()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The 'after' callback will be called after all components from getDependencies() have been started.

        The #after callback is most useful for configuring additional services after all mandatory services are resolved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • configureFactory

                                            java.lang.String... configuration)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a factory configuration with the given properties, just like configure(java.lang.String, java.lang.String...).
        Returns:
        The PID of newly created configuration.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • configureHttpService

        protected void configureHttpService(int port,
                                    java.lang.String... configuration)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        Configures the "org.apache.felix.http" and waits until the service is actually ready to process requests.

        The reason that this method exists is that configuring the Felix HTTP bundle causes it to actually stop and restart, which is done asynchronously. This means that we cannot be sure that depending code is always able to directly use the HTTP service after its been configured.

        Parameters:
        port - the new port to run the HTTP service on;
        configuration - the extra (optional) configuration key/values (as pairs).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        configure(String, String...)

      • configureProvisionedServices

        protected void configureProvisionedServices()
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The 'before' callback will be called after the components from getDependencies() have been added, but you cannot necessarily rely on injected members here. You can use the configure(java.lang.String, java.lang.String...) and configureFactory(java.lang.String, java.lang.String...) methods, as well as the getService(java.lang.Class<T>) methods.

        The #before callback is most useful for configuring services that have been provisioned in the 'configuration' method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDependencies

        protected org.apache.felix.dm.Component[] getDependencies()
        Gets a list of components that must be started before the test is started; this useful to (a) add additional services, e.g. services that should be picked up by the service under test, or (b) to declare 'this' as a component, and get services injected.

        Returns:
        a list of strings, never null.
        Throws:

      • getTestCount

        protected final int getTestCount()
        Utility method to determine the number of test cases in the implementing class.

        Test cases are considered public methods starting their name with "test".

        Returns:
        a test count, >= 0.

      • setAutoDeleteTrackedConfigurations

        protected void setAutoDeleteTrackedConfigurations(boolean aClean)
        Sets whether or not any of the tracked configurations should be automatically be deleted when ending a test.
        Parameters:
        aClean - true (the default) to clean configurations, false to disable this behaviour.
